snippet: Dan Le Batard, a columnist for The Miami Herald and an ESPN host, agreed to turn his ballot over to the website Deadspin.
abstract: Dan Le Batard, columnist for The Miami Herald and an ESPN host, defends his decision to turn over his Baseball Hall of Fame vote to website Deadspin; site opened campaign to buy a vote in order to expose what it considers an overly solemn nomination process dominated by what it calls scolds, handwringers and dimwits.
lead_paragraph: Dan Le Batard, a columnist for The Miami Herald and an ESPN host, agreed to turn his ballot over to the website Deadspin.

headline.main: Writer Gives Away Baseball Hall of Fame Vote to Deadspin
headline.print_headline: Writer Defends The Hall Vote He Gave Away
